verses.verse: Abimelech <WH40> the son <WH1121> of Jerubbaal <WH3378> went <WH3212> to Shechem <WH7927> to his mother <WH517>'s brothers, <WH251> and spoke <WH1696> with them, <WH4940> and with all the family of the house <WH1004> of his mother <WH517>'s father, <WH1> saying, <WH559>

"Please speak <WH1696> in the ears <WH241> of all the men <WH1167> of Shechem, <WH7927> <WH2896> 'Is it better for you that all the sons <WH1121> of Jerubbaal, <WH3378> who are seventy <WH7657> persons, <WH376> rule <WH4910> over you, <WH259> or that one rule <WH4910> over you? <WH2142>' Remember also that I am your bone <WH6106> and your flesh. <WH1320>"

His mother <WH517>'s brothers <WH251> spoke <WH1696> of him in the ears <WH241> of all the men <WH1167> of Shechem <WH7927> all these words: <WH1697> and their hearts <WH3820> inclined <WH5186> to follow <WH310> Abimelech; <WH40> for they said, <WH559> "He is our brother. <WH251>"

They gave <WH5414> him seventy <WH7657> pieces of silver <WH3701> out of the house <WH1004> of Baal Berith, <WH1170> with which Abimelech <WH40> hired <WH7936> vain <WH7386> and light <WH6348> fellows, <WH582> who followed <WH3212> him. <WH310>

He went <WH935> to his father <WH1>'s house <WH1004> at Ophrah, <WH6084> and killed <WH2026> his brothers <WH251> the sons <WH1121> of Jerubbaal, <WH3378> being seventy <WH7657> persons, <WH376> on one <WH259> stone: <WH68> but Jotham <WH3147> the youngest <WH6996> son <WH1121> of Jerubbaal <WH3378> was left; <WH3498> for he hid himself. <WH2244>

All the men <WH1167> of Shechem <WH7927> assembled themselves together, <WH622> and all the house <WH1004> of Millo, <WH4407> and went <WH3212> and made <WH4427> Abimelech <WH40> king, <WH4428> by the oak <WH436> of the pillar <WH5324> that was in Shechem. <WH7927>

When they told <WH5046> it to Jotham, <WH3147> he went <WH3212> and stood <WH5975> on the top <WH7218> of Mount <WH2022> Gerizim, <WH1630> and lifted up <WH5375> his voice, <WH6963> and cried, <WH7121> and said <WH559> to them, <WH8085> "Listen to me, <WH1167> you men of Shechem, <WH7927> that God <WH430> may listen to you. <WH8085>
The trees <WH6086> went forth <WH1980> on a time to anoint <WH4886> a king <WH4428> over them; <WH559> and they said to the olive tree, <WH2132> <WH4427> 'Reign over us.'

"But the olive tree <WH2132> said <WH559> to them, <WH2308> 'Should I leave my fatness, <WH1880> with which by me they honor <WH3513> God <WH430> and man, <WH582> and go <WH1980> to wave <WH5128> back and forth over the trees? <WH6086>'
"The trees <WH6086> said <WH559> to the fig tree, <WH8384> <WH3212> 'Come and reign over us. <WH4427>'

"But the fig tree <WH8384> said <WH559> to them, <WH2308> 'Should I leave my sweetness, <WH4987> and my good <WH2896> fruit, <WH8570> and go <WH1980> to wave <WH5128> back and forth over the trees? <WH6086>'
"The trees <WH6086> said <WH559> to the vine, <WH1612> <WH3212> 'Come and reign over us. <WH4427>'

"The vine <WH1612> said <WH559> to them, <WH2308> 'Should I leave my new wine, <WH8492> which cheers <WH8055> God <WH430> and man, <WH582> and go <WH1980> to wave <WH5128> back and forth over the trees? <WH6086>'
"Then all the trees <WH6086> said <WH559> to the bramble, <WH329> <WH3212> 'Come and reign over us. <WH4427>'

"The bramble <WH329> said <WH559> to the trees, <WH6086> <WH571> 'If in truth you anoint <WH4886> me king <WH4428> over you, <WH935> then come and take refuge <WH2620> in my shade; <WH6738> and if not, <WH784> let fire come out <WH3318> of the bramble, <WH329> and devour <WH398> the cedars <WH730> of Lebanon. <WH3844>'

"Now therefore, <WH6213> if you have dealt truly <WH571> and righteously, <WH8549> in that you have made Abimelech <WH40> king, <WH4427> and if you have dealt <WH6213> well <WH2896> with Jerubbaal <WH3378> and his house, <WH1004> and have done <WH6213> to him according to the deserving <WH1576> of his hands <WH3027>
(for my father <WH1> fought <WH3898> for you, <WH7993> and risked his life, <WH5315> <WH5048> and delivered <WH5337> you out of the hand <WH3027> of Midian: <WH4080>

and you have risen up <WH6965> against my father <WH1>'s house <WH1004> this day, <WH3117> and have slain <WH2026> his sons, <WH1121> seventy <WH7657> persons, <WH376> on one <WH259> stone, <WH68> and have made Abimelech, <WH40> the son <WH1121> of his female servant, <WH519> king <WH4427> over the men <WH1167> of Shechem, <WH7927> because he is your brother <WH251>);

if you then have dealt <WH6213> truly <WH571> and righteously <WH8549> with Jerubbaal <WH3378> and with his house <WH1004> this day, <WH3117> then rejoice <WH8055> in Abimelech, <WH40> and let him also rejoice in you: <WH8055>

but if not, <WH784> let fire come out <WH3318> from Abimelech, <WH40> and devour <WH398> the men <WH1167> of Shechem, <WH7927> and the house <WH1004> of Millo; <WH4407> and let fire <WH784> come out <WH3318> from the men <WH1167> of Shechem, <WH7927> and from the house <WH1004> of Millo, <WH4407> and devour <WH398> Abimelech. <WH40>"
Jotham <WH3147> ran away, <WH1272> and fled, <WH5127> and went <WH3212> to Beer, <WH876> and lived <WH3427> there, <WH6440> for fear of Abimelech <WH40> his brother. <WH251>
Abimelech <WH40> was prince <WH7786> over Israel <WH3478> three <WH7969> years. <WH8141>

God <WH430> sent <WH7971> an evil <WH7451> spirit <WH7307> between Abimelech <WH40> and the men <WH1167> of Shechem; <WH7927> and the men <WH1167> of Shechem <WH7927> dealt treacherously <WH898> with Abimelech: <WH40>

that the violence <WH2555> done to the seventy <WH7657> sons <WH1121> of Jerubbaal <WH3378> might come, <WH935> and that their blood <WH1818> might be laid <WH7760> on Abimelech <WH40> their brother, <WH251> who killed <WH2026> them, <WH1167> and on the men of Shechem, <WH7927> who strengthened <WH2388> his hands to kill <WH2026> his brothers. <WH251>

The men <WH1167> of Shechem <WH7927> set <WH7760> an ambush <WH693> for him on the tops <WH7218> of the mountains, <WH2022> and they robbed <WH1497> all who came <WH5674> along that way <WH1870> by them: <WH5046> and it was told Abimelech. <WH40>

Gaal <WH1603> the son <WH1121> of Ebed <WH5651> came <WH935> with his brothers, <WH251> and went over <WH5674> to Shechem; <WH7927> and the men <WH1167> of Shechem <WH7927> put their trust in him. <WH982>

They went out <WH3318> into the field, <WH7704> and harvested <WH1219> their vineyards, <WH3754> and trod <WH1869> the grapes, <WH6213> and held festival, <WH1974> and went <WH935> into the house <WH1004> of their god, <WH430> and ate <WH398> and drank, <WH8354> and cursed <WH7043> Abimelech. <WH40>

Gaal <WH1603> the son <WH1121> of Ebed <WH5651> said, <WH559> "Who is Abimelech, <WH40> and who is Shechem, <WH7927> that we should serve <WH5647> him? <WH1121> Isn't he the son of Jerubbaal? <WH3378> and Zebul <WH2083> his officer? <WH6496> Serve <WH5647> the men <WH582> of Hamor <WH2544> the father <WH1> of Shechem: <WH7927> but why should we serve him? <WH5647>

Would that this people <WH5971> were under <WH5414> my hand! <WH3027> Then I would remove <WH5493> Abimelech. <WH40>" He said <WH559> to Abimelech, <WH40> "Increase <WH7235> your army, <WH6635> and come out! <WH3318>"
When Zebul <WH2083> the ruler <WH8269> of the city <WH5892> heard <WH8085> the words <WH1697> of Gaal <WH1603> the son <WH1121> of Ebed, <WH5651> his anger <WH639> was kindled. <WH2734>

He sent <WH7971> messengers <WH4397> to Abimelech <WH40> craftily, <WH8649> saying, <WH559> "Behold, <WH1603> Gaal the son <WH1121> of Ebed <WH5651> and his brothers <WH251> have come <WH935> to Shechem; <WH7927> and behold, <WH6696> they incite the city against you. <WH5892>
Now therefore, <WH6965> go up by night, <WH3915> you and the people <WH5971> who are with you, <WH693> and lie in wait in the field: <WH7704>

and it shall be, <WH1242> that in the morning, as soon as the sun <WH8121> is up, <WH2224> you shall rise early, <WH7925> and rush on the city; <WH5892> and behold, <WH5971> when he and the people who are with him come out <WH3318> against you, <WH3027> then may you do <WH6213> to them as you <WH3027> shall find occasion. <WH4672>"
Abimelech <WH40> rose up, <WH6965> and all the people <WH5971> who were with him, <WH3915> by night, and they laid wait <WH693> against Shechem <WH7927> in four <WH702> companies. <WH7218>

Gaal <WH1603> the son <WH1121> of Ebed <WH5651> went out, <WH3318> and stood <WH5975> in the entrance <WH6607> of the gate <WH8179> of the city: <WH5892> and Abimelech <WH40> rose up, <WH6965> and the people <WH5971> who were with him, <WH3993> from the ambush.

When Gaal <WH1603> saw <WH7200> the people, <WH5971> he said <WH559> to Zebul, <WH2083> "Behold, <WH5971> people are coming <WH3381> down <WH3381> from the tops <WH7218> of the mountains. <WH2022>" Zebul <WH2083> said <WH559> to him, <WH7200> "You see the shadow <WH6738> of the mountains <WH2022> as if they were men. <WH582>"

Gaal <WH1603> spoke <WH1696> again <WH3254> and said, <WH1696> "Behold, <WH5971> people are coming <WH3381> down <WH3381> by the middle <WH2872> of the land, <WH776> and one company <WH7218> comes <WH935> by the way of <WH1870> the oak <WH436> of <WH1870> Meonenim. <WH6049>"

Then Zebul <WH2083> said <WH559> to him, <WH645> "Now where is your mouth, <WH6310> that you said, <WH559> <WH40> 'Who is Abimelech, that we should serve <WH5647> him? <WH5971>' Isn't this the people that you have despised? <WH3988> Please go out <WH3318> now <WH4994> and fight with them. <WH3898>"
Gaal <WH1603> went out <WH3318> before <WH6440> the men <WH1167> of Shechem, <WH7927> and fought <WH3898> with Abimelech. <WH40>
Abimelech <WH40> chased <WH7291> him, <WH5127> and he fled before <WH6440> him, <WH7227> and many fell <WH5307> wounded, <WH2491> even to the entrance <WH6607> of the gate. <WH8179>
Abimelech <WH40> lived <WH3427> at Arumah: <WH725> and Zebul <WH2083> drove out <WH1644> Gaal <WH1603> and his brothers, <WH251> that they should not dwell <WH3427> in Shechem. <WH7927>
It happened on the next day, <WH4283> that the people <WH5971> went out <WH3318> into the field; <WH7704> and they told <WH5046> Abimelech. <WH40>

He took <WH3947> the people, <WH5971> and divided <WH2673> them into three <WH7969> companies, <WH7218> and laid wait <WH693> in the field; <WH7704> and he looked, <WH7200> and behold, <WH5971> the people came forth <WH3318> out of the city; <WH5892> He rose up <WH6965> against them, <WH5221> and struck them.

Abimelech, <WH40> and the companies <WH7218> that were with him, <WH6584> rushed forward, and stood <WH5975> in the entrance <WH6607> of the gate <WH8179> of the city: <WH5892> and the two <WH8147> companies <WH7218> rushed on <WH6584> all who were in the field, <WH7704> and struck them. <WH5221>

Abimelech <WH40> fought <WH3898> against the city <WH5892> all that day; <WH3117> and he took <WH3920> the city, <WH5892> and killed <WH2026> the people <WH5971> who were therein: <WH5422> and he beat down the city, <WH5892> and sowed <WH2232> it with salt. <WH4417>
When all the men <WH1167> of the tower <WH4026> of Shechem <WH7927> heard <WH8085> of it, <WH935> they entered into the stronghold <WH6877> of the house <WH1004> of <WH410> Elberith. <WH1286>
It was told <WH5046> Abimelech <WH40> that all the men <WH1167> of the tower <WH4026> of Shechem <WH7927> were gathered together. <WH6908>

Abimelech <WH40> went up <WH5927> to Mount <WH2022> Zalmon, <WH6756> he and all the people <WH5971> who were with him; <WH40> and Abimelech took <WH3947> an axe <WH7134> in his hand, <WH3027> and cut down <WH3772> a bough <WH7754> from the trees, <WH6086> and took <WH5375> it up, <WH7760> and laid it on his shoulder: <WH7926> and he said <WH559> to the people <WH5971> who were with him, <WH7200> "What you have seen me do, <WH6213> make haste, <WH4116> and do <WH6213> as I have done! <WH3644>"

All the people <WH5971> likewise each <WH376> cut down <WH3772> his bough, <WH7754> and followed <WH3212> Abimelech, <WH40> and put <WH7760> them at the base of the stronghold, <WH6877> and set <WH3341> the stronghold <WH6877> on fire <WH784> on them; <WH582> so that all the people of the tower <WH4026> of Shechem <WH7927> died <WH4191> also, <WH505> about a thousand men <WH376> and women. <WH802>
Then went <WH3212> Abimelech <WH40> to Thebez, <WH8405> and encamped <WH2583> against Thebez, <WH8405> and took it. <WH3920>

But there was a strong <WH5797> tower <WH4026> within <WH8432> the city, <WH5892> and there fled <WH5127> all the men <WH582> and women, <WH802> and all they <WH1167> of the city, <WH5892> and shut <WH5462> themselves in, <WH5927> and went up to the roof <WH1406> of the tower. <WH4026>
Abimelech <WH40> came <WH935> to the tower, <WH4026> and fought <WH3898> against it, <WH5066> and drew near to the door <WH6607> of the tower <WH4026> to burn <WH8313> it with fire. <WH784>
A certain <WH259> woman <WH802> cast <WH7993> an upper <WH6400> millstone <WH7393> on Abimelech <WH40>'s head, <WH7218> and broke <WH7533> his skull. <WH1538>

Then he called <WH7121> hastily <WH4120> to the young man <WH5288> his armor bearer, <WH5375> and said <WH559> to him, <WH8025> "Draw your sword, <WH2719> and kill <WH4191> me, <WH559> that men not say of me, <WH802> 'A woman killed <WH2026> him. <WH5288>' His young man thrust him through, <WH1856> and he died. <WH4191>"
When the men <WH376> of Israel <WH3478> saw <WH7200> that Abimelech <WH40> was dead, <WH4191> they departed <WH3212> every man <WH376> to his place. <WH4725>
Thus God <WH430> requited <WH7725> the wickedness <WH7451> of Abimelech, <WH40> which he did <WH6213> to his father, <WH1> in killing <WH2026> his seventy <WH7657> brothers; <WH251>

and all the wickedness <WH7451> of the men <WH582> of Shechem <WH7927> did God <WH430> requite <WH7725> on their heads: <WH7218> and on them came <WH935> the curse <WH7045> of Jotham <WH3147> the son <WH1121> of Jerubbaal. <WH3378>
